intro: Gustavia eximia, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its showy white blossoms. Gustavia eximia is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
